boxes.description: Systematic analysis and documentation of user activities and procedures help us align with the user's key priorities and preferred working style.
Workshops can inspire radical collaboration, derive priorities, and align everyone with a shared understanding of questions and opportunities.
A root cause analysis investigates patterns of negative effects, finding hidden flaws in the system, and discovering specific actions that contributed to the problem.
Usability tests evaluate the impact of a product on user performance and satisfaction.
Observing users in their working environments helps identify unarticulated, habitual needs based on tacit knowledge.
Interviews help us identify explicit and implict issues to create personas, data models, and user stories to drive hills and use cases.
Expert Reviews help evaluate and address usability issues in a shorter time frame than most usability tests.
Competitive evaluations include documenting gaps, identifying overlaps, and other overlooked differentiators.
Data Analysis identifies gaps in the data by assessing data quality, determining data collection opportunities, and concluding with recommended actions.

Data taxonomy enables faster and more efficient searching of needed data elements. A thorough data taxonomy plan offers advantages for handling data elements for analysis, statistical forecasting, and maintenance.
Data ingestion is the process of moving data from its origin point into a system where it can be stored and analyzed. A transformation or conversion step may be necessary.

This type of analysis helps visualize how the data falls into groups. Results may categorize the data as symmetric, roughly symmetric, or non-symmetric. It can also illustrate where the data may be skewed.
Change Assessment measures the organizational and cultural impact of introducting a new data structure to prepare an effective change management strategy.
